page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA
page.content: This pleasant area of Worcestershire in the West Midlands has easy access to several tourist centres including Stratford-on-Avon, Warwick, the Cotswolds, Worcester on the River Severn and the Malvern Hills. The main motorways are in easy reach. The two main villages, Inkberrow and Abbots Morton, are surrounded by agricultural land. Inkberrow, which has a population of approximately 2000, has been developed over the last 20 years into a commuter village. Abbots Morton has not changed in size or character for the last two centuries, although half of its population of approximately 150 commute to their places of work.
